that this nearness by itself made up to him for the day he had lost. He was happy as a lover when the longed-for moment of meeting ar- 
rives. Not daring to look round and without looking round, he was ecstatically conscious of his approach. He felt it not only from the sound of the hoofs of the approaching caval- cade, but because as he drew near everything grew brighter, more joyful, more significant, and more festive around him.
